long_title: Long-term Outcomes of Lidocaine Infusions for Post-Operative Pain (LOLIPOP) Trial
prior_treatment_requirements: Inclusion Criteria:

* Consenting adult female patients (≥18 years) undergoing mastectomy (unilateral or bilateral) or breast conserving surgery (unilateral or bilateral) for the primary excision of confirmed or suspected breast cancer under general anaesthesia (including those with simultaneous insertion of tissue expanders or implants).
* American Society of Anaesthesiologist (ASA) physical scale 1-3
Exclude - Exclusion Criteria:
Exclude - * Pre-existing pain at site of surgery, axilla, ipsilateral side of chest wall or the ipsilateral upper arm
Exclude - * Re-excision procedures where the margins at the index surgery have been deemed insufficient
Exclude - * When immediate autologous reconstruction surgery is planned
Exclude - * Where delayed autologous reconstruction surgery on the operative breast within one year is planned
Exclude - * Planned use of regional analgesia infusions
Exclude - * Impaired cognition
Exclude - * Pregnant or lactating females
Exclude - * Transgender patients
Exclude - * Known metastatic disease

Exclude - * History of anaphylaxis, sensitivity or known contraindication to lidocaine (or other amide local anaesthetic agents e.g. other amide local anaesthetic agents: ropivacaine, bupivacaine, mepivacaine, prilocaine, etidocaine), including patients with porphyria or methaemoglobinaemia
Exclude - * History of epilepsy
Exclude - * Baseline heart rate \< 50 bpm or systolic blood pressure \< 100mmHg.
Exclude - * Acute coronary event in the last three months

Exclude - * Cardiac conduction abnormalities, including; Atrial fibrillation, Heart block (all degrees), Bundle Branch Block or Fascicular block, Prolonged QT interval, Wolf Parkinson White syndrome, channelopathy such as Brugada syndrome. A preoperative Electrocardiogram (ECG) is not mandatory, unless clinically indicated
Exclude - * Abnormal serum potassium concentration (based upon site laboratory reference ranges)
Exclude - * Abnormal serum sodium concentration (based upon site laboratory reference ranges)
Exclude - * Active liver disease e.g. viral hepatitis, alcoholic liver disease, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, haemochromatosis, other rarer causes)

Exclude - * Medications within the last 7 days which are known / suspected to slow lidocaine metabolism (amiodarone, beta blockers, cimetidine, fluoroquinolones, fluvoxamine, imidazoles, macrolides, verapamil, HIV drugs)
Exclude - * Cardiac Failure (any documented heart failure at peroperative assessment or GP records)
Exclude - * Severe Renal Failure (Creatinine Clearance of less than 30ml/min or dialysis dependent)
Exclude - * Co-administration of lidocaine within 24 hours prior to surgery for other reasons (e.g. lidocaine patches
short_title: Long-term Outcomes of Lidocaine Infusions for Post-Operative Pain (LOLIPOP) Trial
summary: The LOLIPOP Trial is a large (n=4,300 patients) pragmatic, international, multicentre, prospective, randomised, double blind, placebo-controlled, parallel assessment, safety and effectiveness superiority study.

arm.arm_description: 2% Lidocaine infusion intra-operative and 10% Lidocaine infusion post-operative.
0.9% Saline infusion intra-operative and 0.9% Saline infusion post-operative.
